name: Resignation of Baron de Stassart
obverse: Bust of Goswin Joseph Augustin, Baron de Stassart facing left.
obverse_inscriptions: GN. JH. AN. BARON DE STASSART
reverse: At the top, three wreaths intertwined with ribbons streaming off of them.
reverse_inscriptions: LES LIBÉRAUX BELGES AU BARON DE STASSART, ÉLU SÉNATEUR PAR LES ARRONDISSEMENS (sic. ARRONDISSEMENTS) DE BRUXELLES NAMUR ET NIVELLES LE 11 JUIN 1839; DESTITUÉ, LE 17, DES FONCTIONS DE GOUVERNEUR DU BRABANT PAR LE MINISTÉRE DE THEUX, EN HAINE DE CETTE TRIPLE ÉLECTION *
references: American Journal of Numismatics and Bulletin of American Numismatic and Archaeological Societies. Quarterly. Vol. XI July, 1876 - July, 1877, p. 32
description: Goswin Joseph Augustin, Baron de Stassart (2 September 1780 – 16 October 1854) was a Dutch-Belgian politician. In 1834 he was appointed by the government as the governor of Brabant. However, in 1838 he had to resign both.
